abstract: Google may not have to bail out Yahoo, smartphones squeeze carrier profits and more.
snippet: Google may not have to bail out Yahoo, smartphones squeeze carrier profits and more.
lead_paragraph: The trend for the day: mixed blessings. For example, the phone companies are selling more smartphones at lower profit margins. On the other hand, Netflix is selling fewer new subscriptions at higher profit margins. You might even call the seeming reluctance of the Justice Department to okay Yahoo’s deal to have Google sell some of its ads a mixed blessing, at least for Google. Now that Microsoft doesn’t seem to want to buy Yahoo, a blocked deal could leave Yahoo, Google’s biggest rival, to wither with no savior in sight.

headline.main: Quick Bits: Google’s Bailout of Yahoo and More
